string-array.name: wild_animal_facts
string-array.item: Grizzly bears possess a biting force of over 1200 PSI, which is enough to crush a bowling ball, or an iron skillet.
Most deer are born with white spots but lose them within a year.
Elephants have around 150,000 muscle units in their trunk.
When fox pups are born, they are unable to see, hear or walk, and their mother must take good care of them.
Giraffes spend most of their lives standing up; they even sleep and give birth standing up.
Because of how huge and muscular their tail is, kangaroos can’t jump backwards.
Lions are the national animal of Albania, Belgium, Bulgaria, England, Ethiopia, Luxembourg, the Netherlands and Singapore.
The Pygmy Marmoset is the smallest type of monkey, with adults weighing between 120 and 140 grams.
Shark skin feels exactly like sandpaper because it is made up of tiny teeth-like structures called placoid scales.
A wolf pup’s eyes are blue at birth. Their eyes turn yellow by the time they are eight months old.

string-array.name: wild_animal_facts_two
string-array.item: Bears care deeply about family members. They will risk their lives and even fight to the death in order to save a cub or sibling from danger.
All species of deer have antlers, with the exception of the Chinese water deer. They have canine teeth which can be as long as 8cm!
An adult elephant can consume up to 300 pounds of food in a single day.
Similar to cats, foxes are nocturnal. Due to their vertically slanted pupils, they have increased visibility in dim light.
A giraffe’s spots are much like human fingerprints. No two individual giraffes have exactly the same pattern.
Female kangaroos sport a pouch on their belly (made by a fold in the skin) to cradle baby kangaroos, called joeys.
Lions can go up to four days without drinking water, but they need to eat everyday.
At the tip of a monkey\'s tail is a patch of bare skin that acts similar to a human\'s fingertips.
When you flip a shark upside down they go into a trance like state called tonic immobility.
Wolves can roam large and long distances, sometimes up to 12 miles (20 kilometers) in a single day.
